intro: Tessaria dodonaeifolia subsp. dodonaeifolia, commonly known as the African violet, is a species of flowering plant in the family Gesneriaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, clustered flowers. The leaves are typically velvety and heart-shaped, with a deep green coloration. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. This plant is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
